content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the shelf. From there, reach a right hand edge, pull through a left hand edge to a pinch below the lip, follow with a right hand to the lip, then make a big reach to the crimp rail up top and finish the problem.
content.protection: Pad or two. The immediate landing is great, but there are some rocks and trees behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs just right of Starálfur on the north face of Tomorrowland.

content.description:
Tomorrowland ascends an overhanging bulge on slopers and edges over a perfect landing.

Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand sidepull. From there, toe in with the right foot, crank up, knee bar, reach a left hand sloper, match a right hand next to it, reach a left hand edge, follow to the spike edges above, toe hook the original knee bar, then reach back to a jug, pull onto the bulge, finish up the remainder using the edges for an easy mantle.
content.protection: Pair of pads. The landing is great though.
content.location: It climbs the northeast arete of Tomorrowland.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the shelf. From there, climb up through a pair of block-pinches (pretty rare for Nine Mile!), reach the lip and mantle on top.
content.protection: Pad or two will work. The immediate landing is great, but there are some downed trees behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs just right of Screwed the Pooch on the east face of Tomorrowland.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of pocket-edges. From there, move up through a shelf and chicken head to reach an easy mantle.
content.protection: Pad will work. The landing is great, but there are some downed trees behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the easternmost section of Tomorrowland's north face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand pocket and a right hand edge. From there, gain the sloping shelf above and match on it, then reach a right hand edge, follow to a left hand crimp below the lip, bump that hand to a crimp at the lip, follow with a right hand to a crimp on the lip, bring the feet up high, commit to the mantle or reach an awkward left hand sidepull and pull on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great, but there is a rock behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs just to the right of Waiting in Comfort on Tomorrowland's north face.
